Add ads to your game with AdMob: Add ads to your game with AdMob
Use AdMob in your GDevelop games to disp: Use AdMob in your GDevelop games to display ads and reward videos to your players
Go to [AdMob website](https://www.google: Go to [AdMob website](https://www.google.com/admob/) and create an account. Then, create a new app from the Admob interface and an ad unit. Note the identifiers for both the app and the ad unit, as they will be used in your game.
In GDevelop, open the properties of your: In GDevelop, open the properties of your game and paste the AdMob **app id**. This will be identified to use your application for AdMob to deliver ads.
Add events in your game to load and show: Add events in your game to load and show the ad when needed (this can be when a level is successfully completed for example). Paste in the parameters of the action the ad unit identifier. You can also enter "test" for loading a test ad.
You can test and publish your game on An: You can test and publish your game on Android directly from GDevelop. In the editor, open your game and then the Export window. Choose Android, click on Export and wait a few minutes.
How to publish to Android in one click: How to publish to Android in one click

Create custom behaviors for your game ob: Create custom behaviors for your game objects in GDevelop
In a few clicks, you can create new beha: In a few clicks, you can create new behaviors for your game objects - using events or JavaScript.
Flash is a custom behavior that is creat: Flash is a custom behavior that is created directly from GDevelop - allowing an object to blink
Create custom behaviors - directly from: Create custom behaviors - directly from GDevelop editor
GDevelop allows you to create new behavi: GDevelop allows you to create new behaviors, using the same events as the ones that you're using to create the rules of your game.
Want enemies to automatically follow the: Want enemies to automatically follow the player?
Want some rockets to target the player?: Want some rockets to target the player?
Want enemies and the players to have hea: Want enemies and the players to have health and take damage?
Behaviors can be created for any kind of: Behaviors can be created for any kind of object, and you can create custom actions and conditions associated to your new behavior.
An action is exposed by the behavior, an: An action is exposed by the behavior, and can be used like any other action in the events
Read the documentation about custom beha: Read the documentation about custom behaviors
Import new behaviors, created by the GDe: Import new behaviors, created by the GDevelop community
Behaviors, as well as extensions, can be: Behaviors, as well as extensions, can be shared between projects. You can **export and import** them in a few clicks. If your behavior is generic and reusable in multiple games, you can even submit it to be integrated in the growing list of custom behaviors shared by the community.
Create your game by assembling behaviors: Create your game by assembling behaviors
Progressively create custom behaviors fo: Progressively create custom behaviors for objects in your game
ideal for large games and keeping simple: ideal for large games and keeping simple events.
Search for new behaviors in the list of: Search for new behaviors in the list of behaviors shared by the community

Install new extensions in GDevelop and s: Install new extensions in GDevelop and share yours
Install new extensions and share them: Install new extensions and share them
Search and add new features to your game: Search and add new features to your game in a few clicks.
Search in the library of extensions, rea: Search in the library of extensions, ready to be installed in one click
Directly from the editor, you can explor: Directly from the editor, you can explore the **online library of extensions** (also called a "package manager" or an "extension store"). Extensions can bring *new behaviors* for your game objects, or *actions, conditions* or expressions that are ready to use in events.
**Featured extensions** are peer reviewe: **Featured extensions** are peer reviewed. They are ideal to add new features at a fast pace to your game, making both prototyping of new games a very quick process and allowing larger games to be constructed by assembling extensions.
Export your own extensions and share the: Export your own extensions and share them
All extensions can be exported to a file: All extensions can be exported to a file. They can easily be shared and integrated to another project. Better, if you have created a useful extension, you can submit it to be integrated to the library of [open-source, community extensions](https://github.com/4ian/GDevelop-extensions).
As extensions are constructed using the: As extensions are constructed using the intuitive GDevelop events sheets, they can be composed of events, [JavaScript or a mix of both](/javascript-game-engine).
How to start a new extension: How to start a new extension
Extensions can provide new behaviors tha: Extensions can provide new behaviors that can be added to your game objects.

Design your own levels with the scene ed: Design your own levels with the scene editor: you can choose objects, put them on the scene, adjust their position and size. You can entirely design your levels with the scene editor. If you want to create complex levels or interfaces, the external layouts allow you to create parts of a level and then reuse them in other scenes.

Imagining and creating the rules of your: Imagining and creating the rules of your game do not imply to learn the syntax of a complex programming language. The events editor displays a sheet of events: each events is composed of conditions and actions. When conditions are fulfilled, actions are run. It's that simple.
All conditions and actions are available: All conditions and actions are available in a list so you can easily discover and find what you want to make the rules of your game.

Develop space shooter games with GDevelo: Develop space shooter games with GDevelop
Everything that is displayed on the scre: Everything that is displayed on the screen of your game is an object. Most objects are called sprites: they are composed of animations and can be used for any animated element. For example, your player, enemies or bonuses to pick.
Other object are also available to creat: Other object are also available to create interfaces or add effects to your game: texts, particles, tiled sprites...
Discover all the objects available in GD: Discover all the objects available in GDevelop
Resources editor, sprite editor and soun: Resources editor, sprite editor and sound effect generator
All the images and audio files used in y: All the images and audio files used in your game are listed in the Resources Editor. It's a simple way to manage your game assets.
GDevelop comes bundled with free assets: GDevelop comes bundled with free assets to get you started! To quickly prototype and create your own assets, GDevelop is also bundled with a powerful pixel art editor called Piskel. You can also create sound effect in a single click using the integrated sound generator. It's perfect for [game jams](/game-jams/)!
Learn everything about the editors in th: Learn everything about the editors in the documentation
Examples of GDevelop - make platformer,: Examples of GDevelop - make platformer, shooter, rpg, action games...
GDevelop is bundled with 80+ examples an: GDevelop is bundled with 80+ examples and starters to get you quickly started, learn or try a specific feature.
These are the examples bundled with GDev: These are the examples bundled with GDevelop. Curious? You can open and try them directly from your browser. GDevelop is fast to start and you'll be playing with the examples in seconds.

GDevelop for Game studios, indies and Ed: GDevelop for Game studios, indies and Education
GDevelop is a fast and flexible game eng: GDevelop is a fast and flexible game engine that can be used for different use cases.
GDevelop is a lightweight game engine, c: GDevelop is a lightweight game engine, carefully designed and open-source. The unique design of the editor has been explained during [talks in international conferences](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6La7jSCnYyk).
MIT license: extend and contribute to th: MIT license: extend and contribute to the engine source code
Adaptable editor based on JavaScript, Re: Adaptable editor based on JavaScript, React.js and WebAssembly
Integrate GDevelop in your team, use eve: Integrate GDevelop in your team, use events or JavaScript according to your needs
Get game designers, artists and develope: Get game designers, artists and developers to work on the same environment
Game projects are human readable and sup: Game projects are human readable and support version control systems like Git or Mercurial
Accessible and easy to learn, GDevelop i: Accessible and easy to learn, GDevelop is ideal for indie game developers. You'll be able to quickly start a game and iterate by using events, behaviors and new extensions.
Free to use: download GDevelop and start: Free to use: download GDevelop and start making a game today
Integrated editors allowing to make game: Integrated editors allowing to make game assets directly from GDevelop
Super fast prototyping with open-source: Super fast prototyping with open-source community extensions and behaviors
Custom behaviors make your game logic re: Custom behaviors make your game logic reusable and shareable
Teaching game creation or programming to: Teaching game creation or programming to kids or students? GDevelop has been used by dozens of schools, universities and bootcamp programs for all ages.
Learn more about GDevelop and education: Learn more about GDevelop and education

Made a nice game with GDevelop?: Made a nice game with GDevelop?
We'll love to know about your game and a: We'll love to know about your game and add it here. Make sure you have beautiful screenshots ready and that the game is high quality :)
Hyperspace Dogfights, a game created wit: Hyperspace Dogfights, a game created with GDevelop
A juicy jet-combat roguelike game, made: A juicy jet-combat roguelike game, made with GDevelop.
Hyperspace Dogfights is a juicy jet-comb: Hyperspace Dogfights is a juicy jet-combat roguelike in which you'll blast, dodge and slice your way through masses of technologically inferior enemies. As your intergalactic intervention mission progresses, your adaptive hyper-jet will evolve into something stronger and weirder by gathering some of the hundreds of items available in the game.
Hyperspace Dogfights began as a side pro: Hyperspace Dogfights began as a side project to our now canceled space exploration roguelike Hyperspace Admirals. HDog was prototyped in late 2016, after which it received a limited early access release on itch.io. Over the course of 2017 the majority of its content was developed and continuous alpha feedback was taken into account. The game was feature-complete in march 2018, after which the release was announced.
Fierce and juicy 2d jet combat against m: Fierce and juicy 2d jet combat against masses of air and ground based enemies
Hundreds of stackable passives, over fif: Hundreds of stackable passives, over fifty weapons and actives; all geared towards producing weird synergies with another
High replayability, your will evolve a l: High replayability, your will evolve a little different on each run
Seven zones with distinct enemy composit: Seven zones with distinct enemy composition to explore
5+ Player hyper-jets to fly, all coming: 5+ Player hyper-jets to fly, all coming with unlockable mk2 loadouts
16 chilled, multi-layered music tracks b: 16 chilled, multi-layered music tracks by Enuit and Ole Toensen
Lil BUB's HELLO EARTH, a game created wi: GDevelop ë¡œ ë§Œë“  Lil BUBì˜ HELLO EARTH

Using GDevelop, the game was made availa: Using GDevelop, the game was made available for iOS, Android, Windows, macOS, Linux and even published as a real Arcade game.
The game was announced for BUB's 5th bir: The game was announced for BUB's 5th birthday. To help making it a reality, a Kickstarter was launched so that all BUB's friends around the world can contribute. The kickstarter was initially launched with $100,000 as the goal, but reached $148,000! GOOD JOB BUB.
Huge variety of unique levels, bosses an: Huge variety of unique levels, bosses and enemies
Unique storyline with twists and surpris: Unique storyline with twists and surprises
Item Inventory: collect items to be used: Item Inventory: collect items to be used strategically throughout the game
Tape Deck feature that allows you to sel: Tape Deck feature that allows you to select your favorite music from the game
Ability to revisit and replay levels to: Ability to revisit and replay levels to further your progress and unlock achievements
GDevelop - Create games without programm: GDevelop-í”„ë¡œê·¸ë¨ë° ì—†ì´ ê²Œì„ë§Œë“¤ê¸°-ë¬´ë£Œ HTML5 ë° ë„¤ì´í‹°ë¸Œ ê²Œì„ í¬ë¦¬ì—ì´í„°
GDevelop game maker software - create vi: GDevelop game maker software - create video games without coding
Make your own games with GDevelop: Make your own games with GDevelop
GDevelop is an open-source, cross-platfo: GDevelop is an open-source, cross-platform game engine designed for everyone - it's extensible, fast and easy to learn.
Unleash your creativity with GDevelop an: Unleash your creativity with GDevelop and create any kind of game: platformers, puzzles, shoot 'em up, strategy, [8-bit games](/make-8bit-pixelart-games)... Go through the examples or start a new project from scratch.
With GDevelop, you can make simple proje: With GDevelop, you can make simple projects for fun or create ambitious indie games like [Lil BUB's HELLO EARTH](/games/lil-bub-hello-earth), [Hyperspace Dogfights](/games/hyperspace-dogfights) and [tons of other games](/games-showcase)!
Events: game creation, intuitive for all: Events: game creation, intuitive for all
What makes GDevelop unique and so easy t: What makes GDevelop unique and so easy to use are the events. Events are a powerful way to express the logic of your game, without having to learn a programming language.
GDevelop takes visual programming to the: GDevelop takes visual programming to the next step, allowing you to add [ready-made behaviors](/features) to your game objects and [make new behaviors](/custom-behaviors) using these intuitive, easy to learn events.
Events being used in GDevelop to create: Events being used in GDevelop to create the logic of a game
When Space is pressed, the character ani: When Space is pressed, the character animation and a sound are played. If a bomb touches the character, they both are destroyed.
Export your game anywhere, in one click: Export your game anywhere, in one click
Publish your games to the web, iOS, Andr: Publish your games to the web, iOS, Android, Windows, Mac, Linux and even [Facebook Messenger](/facebook-instant-games). Games created with GDevelop run anywhere and you can even do a one-click export to Android from the app.
Make games for iOS, Android, Windows, ma: Make games for iOS, Android, Windows, macOS and Linux
Laptop, tablets or phone: games made wit: Laptop, tablets or phone: games made with GDevelop can run everywhere
Express your small and big ideas: you ca: Express your small and big ideas: you can prototype new features on your games in minutes, and refine them without limits. [Making games](/games-showcase) has never been so easy and fast, with [the visual editors](/game-editors) provided by GDevelop.
Want to go even further? You can extend: Want to go even further? You can extend the [game engine with Javascript](/javascript-game-engine).
See how to add a trigger button to your: See how to add a trigger button to your platformer game in 90 seconds
[Tons of examples](/game-examples-starte: [Tons of examples](/game-examples-starters) are also available and ready to be tried in one click.
Tutorials for GDevelop and documentation: Tutorials for GDevelop and documentation on the wiki
Using JavaScript to make your games with: Using JavaScript to make your games with GDevelop
GDevelop supports JavaScript to create y: GDevelop supports JavaScript to create your game or extend the game engine.
JavaScript can be used to write part of: JavaScript can be used to write part of a game, alongside with events
Add JavaScript code blocks inside your g: Add JavaScript code blocks inside your game
GDevelop supports adding JavaScript code: GDevelop supports adding JavaScript code blocks at any point in the events of your game. It's a good way to implement a complex algorithm or reuse functions from open-source libraries. Events and code blocks can seamlessly be mixed together - so you can implement parts or even the totality of your game with JavaScript!
The JavaScript editor is based on the su: The JavaScript editor is based on the super powerful Monaco Editor, extracted from [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/). Intellisense autocompletions are provided and the editor supports advanced features like multi-selection for faster coding.
GDevelop is modular and can be extended: GDevelop is modular and can be extended to suit your needs. In particular, all features available to games (objects, behaviors, events) are based on the extension system. You can quickly create new extensions for your game or contribute to existing ones as GDevelop is [open-source](https://github.com/4ian/GD).
The Dark theme being used in GDevelop. T: The Dark theme being used in GDevelop. The code editor also comes bundled with several beautiful themes!
Make your own 8-bit and pixelart games: Make your own 8-bit and pixelart games
Sprite editor and tools to make your own: Sprite editor and tools to make your own 8bit games with GDevelop
See Piskel sprite editor being used insi: See Piskel sprite editor being used inside GDevelop to make a 8bit game
GDevelop is bundled with [Piskel](https:: GDevelop is bundled with [Piskel](https://www.piskelapp.com/), a powerful and easy to use 2D sprite editor. It's the perfect tool to create pixel art assets to give a retro feeling to your game! You can create objects with multiple animations, edit at any time the sprites and see the result by launching a preview of your game.

Lil BUB's HELLO EARTH is a retro 8-bit g: Lil BUB's HELLO EARTH is a retro 8-bit game, with beautiful arts and soundtrack, which alternates between platformers levels, with hidden secrets, and shooter levels with bosses, multiple enemies and bonuses.

There either has been an error or you ca: There either has been an error or you cancelled the subscription. If you want to get a subscription to support GDevelop and unlock online services, try again to choose one from GDevelop (*My Profile* menu).
As an open-source software, GDevelop req: As an open-source software, GDevelop requires time and money to be developed and sustainable. Thanks for your contribution! If you want to get more involved, you can also [read all the ways](/contribute) to contribute to GDevelop ecosystem.
You can now **go back to GDevelop** to u: You can now **go back to GDevelop** to use the additional online exports and services.
